case.summary: Sentencing of accused for driving while disqualified and possession of fraudulent credit cards. The accused pleaded guilty. The accused was on parole at the time of the offences. The accused had a lengthy criminal record and had a substance abuse problem. HELD: The accused was sentenced to 120 days imprisonment and a one-year driving prohibition. Considering the circumstances of the offence and the accused's circumstances, the joint submission as to sentence was appropriate.
